turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Biological aspects of fluorine.
turn.1: What are the biological aspects of fluorine?
turn.2: Owing to its lesser chemical dissociation in water (remaining a neutral molecule), hydrogen fluoride penetrates tissue more quickly than typical acids.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Poisoning can occur readily through the skin or eyes or when inhaled or swallowed.
turn.5: Are there any treatment or preventive measures?
turn.6: From 1984 to 1994, at least nine workers died in the United States from accidents with HF.
turn.7: What other effects can be expected?
turn.8: Once in the blood, hydrogen fluoride reacts with calcium and magnesium, resulting in electrolyte imbalances, potentially including hypocalcemia.
turn.9: Can you tell me more about the possible effects on the body?
turn.10: The consequent effect on the heart (cardiac arrhythmia) may be fatal.
turn.11: What other fluorine related issues are there?
turn.12: Formation of insoluble calcium fluoride also causes severe pain.
